intro: Lepechiniella inconspicua, commonly known as the small lepechiniella, is a small, perennial herb native to South America. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Its flowers are tiny, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are often pink or purple in color. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is known for its aromatic properties.
